content.question: Which of the following types of data would most likely demonstrate a positive effect of economic globalization and thereby undermine the authorsâ€™ argument regarding free trade?

choices.label: Data on healthcare expenditure per capita in Western Europe and North America in the 1990s
Data on employment levels and personal disposable income in Pacific Rim Asian countries in the 1990s
Data on employment levels in traditional manufacturing areas of developed countries, such as the United States Rust Belt or the British Midlands, in the 1990s
Data on the global growth of HIV infections in the 1990s

content.answer: Data on employment levels and personal disposable income in Pacific Rim Asian countries in the 1990s

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain the significance of a source's point of view, purpose, historical situation, and/or audience, including how these might limit the use(s) of a source.
